QAs.question: What is the empirical formula of compound 1?
What method was used to measure the crystal structures?
QAs.answer: The crystal structures were measured on a Rigaku Oxford Diffraction SuperNova system using Cu Kα radiation.

QAs.question: How was the solvent content in the crystal structure of [Na(OCP)(dioxane)3] determined?
QAs.answer: The solvent content in the crystal structure of [Na(OCP)(dioxane)3] was determined to be three molecules per formula unit, contrary to the previously reported 2.5 molecules per formula unit.

QAs.question: What was the purpose of adding 18-crown-6 to the solution of [Na(16)(thf)3]?
QAs.answer: 18-crown-6 was added to the solution of [Na(16)(thf)3] to enhance the resolution of the 31P{1H} NMR spectrum, allowing for the simulation of the NMR spectrum.

QAs.question: What was the result of the reaction between LGa and P4 in the presence of 2,3-dimethylbutadiene?
QAs.answer: The reaction between LGa and P4 in the presence of 2,3-dimethylbutadiene resulted in a mixture that showed four very broad signals in the 31P{1H} NMR spectrum, indicating no clear reaction product could be identified.

QAs.question: Is the compound exo-endo-10 stable at room temperature?
QAs.answer: No, the compound exo-endo-10 is not stable at room temperature as it isomerizes to form a mixture of exo-endo-10 and endo-endo-10.

QAs.question: Does the compound 3 crystallize with toluene?
QAs.answer: Yes, the compound 3 crystallizes with half of a molecule of toluene.

QAs.question: Was the hydrogen atom position in compound 17 localized in the difference Fourier map?
QAs.answer: Yes, in the crystal structure of compound 17, the hydrogen atom position was localized in the difference Fourier map.

QAs.question: What was the Flack parameter for the crystal structure of compound 1?
QAs.answer: The Flack parameter for the crystal structure of compound 1 was not provided.

QAs.question: What was the method used for the synthesis of sodium phosphaethynolate (NaOCP)?
QAs.answer: The synthesis of sodium phosphaethynolate (NaOCP) was performed according to the procedure published by Grützmacher et al.
